lenders.name: Jacqueline Hope
lenders.loan_because: I know what it means to not have enough, and to try to be creative in order to make things work.  Seminary alone was an exercise in poverty!  I love that Kiva allows me to loan small amounts, which is important given I still do not make a lot of money and am paying back my own student loans.  I value how I can join others to make a difference--it is all not up to me, but I can be a part of something big all the same.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an ordained Protestant minister in the United Church of Christ.  I have never worked as the pastor of a church though.  My work has been focused on helping people of all faiths--and lack thereof--in health care settings when they face the crisis of injury or illness.  Not only do I know a great deal about the many faith paths, but also a lot about helping people narrate meaning even in the midst of terrible pain, i.e. re-writing their story so the end is not just loss.  I am a HUGE believer in healing, even when cure is not possible, and this belief is the cornerstone of all my work.  I am shifting in my path towards working more with women in difficult circumstances.  I also write about my work and life on my website.

lenders.name: frank
lenders.loan_because:
I hope to raise recurring residual streams in the future to fund projects like this and others. I believe everyone can make a difference even if it is only a small donation at first. If we recognize where help is most needed and we address those issues without discrimination we stand a good chance in making real development growth possible. I donate because I want to donate, not because I have to? I have created an article that may bring in commissions which if set on an autopilot system, and correct payment processors are in place, this could very well be what I have pursued to create. 

http://www.dofollowuntacticcal000.com/Mass_Articles/Changing Lives In The Manner Of Creating A Purpose0.pdf
lenders.occupational_info: In simply recognizing that there is a much greater need for those of us who have access to online tools and secured systems, to make a concerted effort towards changing lives with the hope that we can one day finally eradicate poverty. Even now as I am a self-made homeless man on the streets of Perth in Western Australia, I recognize the importance of donating and micro-financing, it is the future of all our people for the future. http://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/a/-/wa/9098758/photo-helps-widower-get-back-on-feet/

"Wat je bezit is op weg naar anderen" 
"Whatever you own today is already on its way to someone else"
(Dutch poet  Willem Hussem, translated into English by me)
*****
Running a small business myself, I can't but feel deep respect and admiration for all those brave women who do the same in much more difficult circumstances.

lenders.name: Project2000International
lenders.loan_because:
We run the same program in Haiti and it had a tremendous impact in the lives of those not able to access the credit market. We are currently mobilizing funds for our projects in Haiti, if you can, please make a donation. If not, forward our request to your lists on our behalf. 

Project 2000 International, Inc. has its core service as education. We believe that if people are educated, opportunities will result. We have now began to grow beyond our core service by providing health services, agricultural education, micro-credit and training schools in order to develop a sustainable entrepreneurial revolution in Haiti. Please, help us in securing funding for our programs. We are a 501c3 organization; your donations are tax deductible. 

http://www.project2000international.org/eng_agriculture.htm 

http://www.project2000international.org/eng_credit.htm
lenders.occupational_info: Very rewarding in seeing the difference that so little can make.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: It changes lives and allows people to rise above their circumstances through there own hard work and efforts.
lenders.occupational_info: I own and operate my own trucking business.

lenders.name: ewalk
lenders.loan_because: Micro Loans made to Entrepreneurs for Sustained Development Enterprises  will improve the lives of millions in poverty while helping the world's chance of survival
lenders.occupational_info: We take pictures of real estate for people trying to sell a house. Our team consists of our corporation, employees, customers, and partners.

lenders.name: Friends Beyond Borders
lenders.loan_because: My students enjoy reading about the people and projects that are presented on Kiva. We hope that we can contribute our grain of rice in the struggle against poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher (ESL/World Languages) and PD coach interested in helping colleagues consider  global education and social justice issues in teaching activities across the curriculum.  I organize an annual social justice tour where participants learn about the root causes of extreme poverty in the developing word. We visit the Dominican Republic and Haiti each summer and then collaborate on teaching activities.  See my webpage.

lenders.name: Colby
lenders.loan_because: Philanthropic reasons, great thing to do with money.
lenders.occupational_info: Build residential houses from 7am - 4pm, and a student/artist every night.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I am able to... and we're all in this together.
lenders.occupational_info: I help provide affordable rental housing to low income individuals and families.

lenders.name: Pope John Paul II School
lenders.loan_because: I feel it is important for today's youth to understand how much of an effect they can have on those they do not know, by giving.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher, and my students are eager to learn about how they can help others in the world.

lenders.name: Heather, Anita, Emily
lenders.loan_because: as sisters, we prefer the gift of giving.  Our Kiva loans are given in lieu of holiday gifts to one another.
lenders.occupational_info: One sister is a pharmacist (prepares and sells medications) one is a dental hygienist (cleans teeth) and one runs a business (keeps track of money).  All three are wives and mothers, too!

lenders.name: anna
lenders.loan_because: I am able to.

lenders.name: Sheila
lenders.loan_because:
Whatever you give out to others, God will eventually give back to you. This is the basic nature of God's Justice:   "YOU REAP WHAT YOU SOW."    

"Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a
              man soweth, that shall he also reap." (Galatians 6:7 KJV)
lenders.occupational_info: I am a nurse.

lenders.name: Topsy
lenders.loan_because: I like humans.
lenders.occupational_info: Nap, eat, nap.

lenders.name: Colin
lenders.loan_because: I want to spare entrepeneurs the pain of bureacracy and bank indifference.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with computers, making programs and web sites.

lenders.name: Becky
lenders.loan_because: In honor of my mom, Becky Gray's, birthday!

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who are motivated to help themselves and do something productive
lenders.occupational_info: I work with small companies helping them with their financial and management challenges

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: It's a good thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I enable people to efficiently apply and use technology to further their Businesses.

lenders.name: Jennifer and Abigail
lenders.loan_because: We need to help one another.

lenders.name: Ryan Allis
lenders.loan_because: of wanting to help create more successful entrepreneurs
lenders.occupational_info: technology entrepreneur

lenders.name: Joe
lenders.loan_because: I have a great life and I want to share it.
lenders.occupational_info: I help to maintain computer networks for a great company, Tuthill, which is an international manufacturing company.

lenders.name: Jhoanna
lenders.loan_because: It is more blessed to give than to receive -- Acts 20:35
lenders.occupational_info: Mama, Wife, Christian, Illustrator/Crafter, Blogger, Runner and Wanderer.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I like helping people with their Lives and businesses and let them grow to help other people.
lenders.occupational_info: Bookstore Clerk

lenders.name: Emery
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping others and empowering them to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with groups of elders using art to help them and hopefully improve their lives.  We draw, paint, create mosaics, quilt, and explore materials.  Many of the people I work with have some form of Dementia or memory problems.

lenders.name: Jack
lenders.loan_because: I believe that micro-loans are the best way for me as an individual to  share my economic success with my fellow human beings.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired teacher of English, German, and Spanish.

lenders.name: Mrs.Baum's 5th Graders
lenders.loan_because: we are learning about how we can empower people less forturnate than us to succeed!

lenders.name: Robbin
lenders.loan_because: "Each man should give what he has decided in his heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver."  II Corinthians 9:7

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in real people's every day lives.
